Overview.Description: The "PianoTeacher" app teaches music theory through two modes: "Guess the Note" and "Chord Mode." "Guess the Note" is a standalone mode where users identify random notes indefinitely. "Chord Mode" consists of 6 progressive stages, each focusing on a specific music theory concept (chords, inversions, progressions). Users must complete 5 correct attempts (configurable via SUCCESSFUL_ATTEMPTS_REQUIRED = 5) to advance to the next stage in Chord Mode. A visual indicator shows the current stage and remaining attempts (e.g., "Stage 1: Building Basic Chords - 3/5 correct to advance"). The app uses a provided Piano.js component for the 25-key piano (C3-C5, MIDI 48-72), with notes and notesArray available for note lookups. An example gameEngine.js is provided as a reference for structuring the game logic.

Constants.Constant: Number of correct attempts required to advance to the next stage in Chord Mode. Configurable.

Mode.name: GuessTheNote
Mode.Description: - A practice mode where users identify random notes from C3 to C5 (MIDI 48-72). - The app plays a note using Tone.js, highlights it in yellow on the piano, and the user must play it back via MIDI or clicking. - Correct guesses turn the key green (positiveMatchColor), incorrect ones turn it red (negativeMatchColor). - Feedback (e.g., "Correct!" or "Try again") appears below the piano. - This mode runs indefinitely until the user exits. - When user press an incorrect note, we should still hear the note played by the app, so the user can compare it with the note they played. - After each attempt, the app should play the target note again. - The app should not play the target note if the user has already played the correct note. - There will be a "Visual Indicator" toggle to show/hide the target note on the piano. When enabled, the target note will be highlighted in yellow.

Evaluation.Description: Compare the pressed key to the target note. If the pressed MIDI note matches the target, return true (correct); otherwise, return false (incorrect).

Progress.Description: There are no stages in this mode. The game continues indefinitely, presenting random notes until the user exits the mode.

Mode.name: ChordMode
Mode.Description: A progressive mode with 6 stages, each teaching a music theory concept. Users must complete 5 correct attempts (SUCCESSFUL_ATTEMPTS_REQUIRED) to advance to the next stage. A visual indicator shows the current stage and remaining attempts (e.g., "Stage 1: Building Basic Chords - 3/5 correct to advance"). Correct attempts increment a counter; incorrect attempts do not. After 5 correct attempts, the stage advances, resetting the counter. If at Stage 6, loop back to Stage 1 or show a completion message (configurable). Feedback appears below the piano for each attempt.

VisualIndicator.Description: Display the current stage number, stage name, and remaining attempts (e.g., "Stage 1: Building Basic Chords - 3/5 correct to advance"). Update after each attempt.

Stage.Name: Building Basic Chords
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Learn to construct major (1-3-5) and minor (1-b3-5) triads. Understand the 1-3-5 formula for major chords and 1-b3-5 for minor. Build major/minor chords in any key (focus on C, G, F major scales).

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Build any major or minor triad on the keyboard.
Explain the construction of major (1-3-5) and minor (1-b3-5) chords.
Play major/minor chords of C, G, F major scales.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the target chord (same length, all notes included).

Stage.Name: Chord Inversions
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Learn chord inversions (root, first, second). Understand how inversions affect sound. Play inversions smoothly.

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Explain the concept of inversions (e.g., root: 1-3-5, first: 3-5-1).
Play a major/minor chord in any inversion when asked.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the target chord (ignoring inversion for simplicity).

Stage.Name: Chord Progressions - The Basics
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Introduce Roman numeral system (I-ii-iii-IV-V-vi-viiÂ°). Learn basic progressions in major keys (I-IV-V, I-vi-IV-V). Practice playing common progressions.

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Identify chords in a progression using Roman numerals.
Play basic progressions in different keys.
Explain major/minor chord patterns in a major scale.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the current chord in the progression. Advance to the next chord if correct.

Stage.Name: Chord Progressions - Expanding Horizons
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Introduce common progressions (I-vi-ii-V, ii-V-I). Learn to transpose progressions to different keys. Recognize progressions in songs.

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Transpose a progression to any key.
Identify the progression of a simple song.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the current chord in the transposed progression. Advance to the next chord if correct.

Stage.Name: Seventh Chords and Beyond
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Learn to build seventh chords (major 7th, minor 7th, dominant 7th). Understand how seventh chords add color. Experiment with augmented chords.

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Add out-of-scale chords and explain their use.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the target seventh or augmented chord.

Stage.Name: Ear Training and Application
Stage.IntendedTeaching: Refine ability to identify chords and progressions by ear. Apply knowledge to analyze and create music. Use progressions to write songs.

SuccessfulCriteria.Criterion: Accurately identify progressions in complex songs.
Create your own progressions and write music.
Explain the theory behind your progressions.

Evaluation.Description: Check if pressed keys match the current chord in the progression. Allow custom progressions if specified.
